result.title: Closing Conference ENMI_2023
result.description: (D1.1.4 in the proposal) Rethinking theoretical computer science closing conference (ENMI 2022 Centre Pompidou, Paris) (M29)An international conference organized by IRI and Bernard Stiegler gathering major researchers from mathematics, anthropology, philosophy, psychology,computer science, biology. Best papers presented in this event will be published with Fyp Edition in French and Open Humanities Press in English (M32).

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Document describing how NEST Consortium will manage the research data during the life of the research project and where the data will be deposited so far as to ensure its preservation and reuse. The DMP will be compliant with GDPR. The DMP will state the following:1- Sources of the data. Methodologies of collection, creation and tools.2- Data format (e.g. ASCII, excell, word, open source etc...) and reasons for choosing a particular format and how it will be back up. Keywords: format/ standards and backup.3- How the data will be organised, documented and described.4- Data storage and security5-Data sharing6-Implementation

result.title: Conference of the Commons
result.description: Four international exchanges related to four training events organised in UA, TU Dublin, Paris Lumiere, IRI on Collective ecological individuation culminating in a one-day Conference of the commons taking place in Poland and (if possible) in collaboration with and as part of the ILIA conference in Ecuador. Topics will reflect the local diversity of each territory and the ensuing need for cultural specificity in the use and implementation of socially engaged projects and social digital technologies for the smart citizen. The forum discussion will be hosted in an annotation platform (M31)One book or monographic journal issue as proceedings (M42).

result.title: Two day Conference Ethics and Computation
result.description: Two-day conference devoted to exploring some of the Ethical Blindspots of Ubiquitous Computation will gather ERs and ESRs from the various partner institutions as well as other speakers. It will be hosted and organized by UPL in the ArTeC Graduate School, and will include a Prospective Workshop on an ecological design approach to the Public Space provided by the Paragraphe Research Lab. The outcomes can be published in the form of a collective book, published by ArTeC/Les Presses du Rel or by the UGA Editions in Grenoble (M40)

result.title: Archipelago of the living Summer Academy 2 & Report
result.description: Archipelago of the living Second Summer Academy This second summer academy will take place in Guayaquil and be focused on the case of Puna Island interspecies conflicts in relation to analog ecological issues in Ireland and Corsica.A report on the summer academy 2 will be provided.

result.title: Report with the current state, progress made up to date and future challenges of advanced technologies for efficient CO2 valorisation at multiple scales, from pilot to market scale, in the European Union
result.description: State of the art to valorize CO2 through biological processes (T4.1): The report contains the state of the art of the CO2 valorization focusing on main purposes (e.g. material utilisation of CO2 in the chemical industry for the production of basic chemicals, in the food industry, packaging industry, etc.). Thereby, as a result EU-wide locations of (pilot) plants, plant capacities, respective advanced technologies, the TRL of the respective technology, value-added specific products resulting from valorization of CO2 and process productivity (if available) will be provided (in form of data visualization/maps and tables). Moreover, different scales in the EU will be considered with respect to the progress made up to date and future challenges of advanced technologies.

category.title: Fight against threats to the Environment

result.title: Post Growth Workshop
result.description: Post-Growth Workshop (M26) and Toolkit (M36) The artistic collective DisNovation will host a weeklong workshop devoted to learning, practicing and spreading ecological practices adapting our activities to a post-growth future. It will be conceived and led by digital artists Nicolas Maigret and Maria Roszkowska and will travel to the various partner institutions interested in hosting it. (DisNovation can send two members to the hosting institutions for one month.). A toolkit (with videos, game cards, role play) will be produced by DisNovation, accumulating the new material generated by each workshop.

result.title: Ecological Mutations Seminar
result.description: Seven months Research-Creation seminar on Ecological Mutations. The ArTeC Graduate School will offer a seven months seminar in English open to ESRs from partner institutions, wherein researchers in social sciences, artists and designers in digital technologies will build a common theoretical culture and collaborate towards devising creative alternatives to the current (ab)uses of material resources, human resources and data. The seminar will be led by Yves Citton, involving senior researchers, artists and thinkers both internal and external to the ArTeC consortium. Thanks to the resources of the Paragraphe Research Lab, this will include the design of interactive installations helping citizens to test end reflect upon their visions of digital ecology (Up to 10 ESR can be hosted in Paris for the 7 months. Several ER can be hosted for a month to teach in the seminar.).A special issue of the bilingual journal Hybrid (English-French) will be published with the most accomplished outcomes of the seminar Research-Creation in Ecological Mutations
